content.text:
# Edward Lloyd (16th-century MP)

Edward Lloyd (by 1508 â€“ 1547) was an English politician.
Lloyd was an MP for Buckingham in 1529. He was a yeoman of the wardrobe to Queen Anne Boleyn. In 1545, he was a member of the household of Katherine Parr, the sixth wife of Henry VIII. There is confusion in identifying Lloyd, and his surname may have been Sooll, Powell or Floyd.
He had a daughter named Joan, who was his heiress.
